name: desktop-commander
description: Build, explore, and automate on your local machine with access to files and terminal.
long_description:
Combine local filesystem access with full terminal control to handle technical tasks through natural language. Desktop Commander empowers you to build, explore, and automate - from organizing repositories to creating complete applications:
* **Build from scratch** - Create features and applications with simple commands
* **Manage development environments** - Set up servers, configure systems, and handle processes
* **Manage context and documentation** - Keep track of project details and technical specifications
* **Explore existing codebases and projects** - Navigate and understand complex repositories

This extension bridges technical skill gaps by providing full command-line superpowers through an interface that understands your intent and handles complexity automatically.

tools.name: get_config
tools.description: Get the complete server configuration including blocked commands, allowed directories, file limits, telemetry settings, client info, and system information.

tools.name: set_config_value
tools.description: Set a specific configuration value by key. WARNING: Should be used in a separate chat from file operations to prevent security issues.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the contents of a file from the file system or URL with optional offset and length parameters. Supports partial reading and handles images.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. Handles text files and renders images.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Write or append to file contents. Always write files in chunks of 25-30 lines maximum for best performance.

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed recursive listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Supports depth parameter (default: 2) for multi-level directory traversal.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories between locations.

tools.name: start_search
tools.description: Start a streaming search for files by name or content within files. Returns results progressively with session ID.

tools.name: get_more_search_results
tools.description: Get more results from an active search with offset-based pagination.

tools.name: stop_search
tools.description: Stop an active search gracefully when you've found what you need.

tools.name: list_searches
tools.description: List all active searches with their status and runtime information.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory including size, timestamps, permissions, and line counts.

tools.name: edit_block
tools.description: Apply surgical text replacements to files. Make small, focused edits with minimal context for precision.

tools.name: start_process
tools.description: Start a new terminal process with intelligent state detection. Primary tool for local file analysis (CSV, JSON, logs, etc.).

tools.name: read_process_output
tools.description: Read output from a running process with intelligent completion detection and REPL prompt recognition.

tools.name: interact_with_process
tools.description: Send input to a running process and automatically receive the response. Critical tool for all local file analysis.

tools.name: force_terminate
tools.description: Force terminate a running terminal session.

tools.name: list_sessions
tools.description: List all active terminal sessions with status information including blocked state and runtime.

tools.name: list_processes
tools.description: List all running processes with PID, command name, CPU usage, and memory usage.

tools.name: kill_process
tools.description: Terminate a running process by PID. Use with caution.

tools.name: get_usage_stats
tools.description: Get usage statistics for debugging and analysis including tool usage and performance metrics.

tools.name: get_recent_tool_calls
tools.description: Get recent tool call history with their arguments and outputs. Returns chronological list of tool calls made during this session for debugging, context recovery, and onboarding new chats.

tools.name: give_feedback_to_desktop_commander
tools.description: Open feedback form in browser to provide feedback about Desktop Commander.

tools.name: get_prompts
tools.description: Browse and retrieve curated Desktop Commander prompts for various tasks and workflows.
